NORMALIZATION LOGIC & RATIONALE:
----------------------------------------
Rule-Set P23 applies semantic normalization for edge cases:

📖 VERSE 39:29 - Three 'rajul' forms in single parable:
   Arabic: 'رَّجُلًا فِيهِ شُرَكَآءُ... وَرَجُلًا سَلَمًا لِّرَجُلٍ'
   Forms: رَّجُلًا (man1) + رَجُلًا (man2) + رَجُلٍ (man3)
   Translation: 'A man with partners... and a man at peace with a man'
   Logic: Drop the third role to keep single referent per comparison side
   Found: 3 tokens → Normalized to: 2 (drop 1)

📖 VERSE 66:10 - Multiple 'imra'ah' for same narrative:
   Arabic: 'ٱمْرَأَتَ نُوحٍ وَٱمْرَأَتَ لُوطٍ'
   Translation: 'The wife of Noah and the wife of Lot'
   Logic: Single example of faithless wives → count as single concept
   Found: 2 tokens → Normalized to: 1

🎯 WHY NORMALIZATION MAKES SENSE:
   • Avoids double-counting within single semantic units
   • Focuses on distinct conceptual references rather than raw tokens
   • Prevents artificial inflation from literary parallelism
   • Aligns with linguistic principle: meaning over mechanics
   • Results in more precise semantic balance
